content: evanesce shawl designed by lisa hounshell since there are special techniques for continuously working the hexagons in this shawl you will need to be familiar with the basics of breakaway crochet therefore if you have not done so already please refer to the following resources before you attempt this project ● for the basic concept and techniques start by downloading the free training wheels primer ebook from ravelry and/or watching the quick start tutorial breakaway crochet method video on youtube ● for a tutorial for this specific project please watch this youtube video ● for more information please keep in touch i will be publishing free patterns in my ravelry pattern shop lisa hounshell designs as they become available subscribe to my youtube channel https //youtube com/@breakawaycrochet to be notified of new video tutorials materials yarn 6 balls bamboo blended lf from yatsal each ball = 240yards/219meters 3 53 ounces / 100 grams hook us size d3 3 25 mm stitch markers measurements length 64 / 162cm height 16 / 41cm stitch gauge us double_crochet 20 sts and 11 row = 4 / 10cm 1 abbreviations us terminology yo yarn over slip_stitch slip_stitch chain chain stitch single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet double_crochet trtr triple treble yo 4 times insert hook into floating ring yo and draw through a loop yo and pull through 2 loops 5 times ftrtr floating triple treble 4 yo make floating ring yo and pull through 2 loops 5 times double_crochet/double_crochet 2 dcs worked over 2 row at the same time yo insert hook and draw up a loop through the 2nd pull-through from the hook yo skip next pull-through insert hook and draw up a loop through the next pull-through 5 loops on hook yo pull through 2 loops 4 times double_crochet/single_crochet a double_crochet and a single_crochet worked over 2 row at the same time yo insert hook and draw up a loop through the 2nd pull-through from hook insert hook and draw up a loop through the next pull-through 4 loops on hook yo pull through 2 loops 3 times w1 wedge 1 double_crochet into 2nd pull-through from hook double_crochet/double_crochet twice double_crochet into 2nd pull-through from hook w2 wedge 2 double_crochet into 2nd pull-through from hook double_crochet/single_crochet twice double_crochet into 2nd pull-through from hook w3 wedge 3 4 double crochets worked into 2nd pull-through from hook w4 wedge 4 2 single crochets worked into 1st pull-through from hook pattern notes pattern sequence this shawl consists of hexagons that can be worked end-lessly one after the other without ever having to cut the yarn between each one to give you an overview the end-less hexagons are crocheted in row which should be worked in the sequence described below 2 on the first foundation row you will begin a hexagon work to the breakaway point for that hexagon then start a new hexagon continue working partial hexagons in this way from left to right until you reach the required number for the row return row are worked from
